messages.message:
Hi team,
We started seeing the following alert in aihub prod - https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C06JPSJEPLK/p1733989109385159
On further investigation I found out that this pod has an incorrect image tag - `24.04.0` which should ideally be `24.46.5-aihub-*` , this had manual in its name so I am not sure if this was created manually or through some cronjob, the older jobs have completed successfully and had the correct image tag.
I have deleted this job to stop the alerts.
cc @sudeep
yeah I have seen this last week as well
Connector image needs to be added certify
@Kerry i am not aware of this - looked to be a manually created job in aihub env with incorrect image. I asked Puneet to delete it for now.
We shared this here so that someone can tell us what this is as it was also creating alerts
can you wait on deleting this?
@Ashwin just want to make sure -- this is not the envoy restart cron job right?
Its already removed - it was failing anyway and creating alerts
No this is not envoy cleanup

We checked this seems to be using a gdrive connector image, and said “manual” in the name. The image was incorrect so this job would fail and create an alert. The envoy cleanup job was separate based on what Puneet showed
